generated_description:
**Kidato: Transforming K-12 Education in Africa**

Founded in 2020 and hailing from Nairobi, Kenya, Kidato is on a mission to innovate the educational landscape in Africa. With a clear focus on K-12 education, Kidato offers a compelling alternative to the public and private school options available to parents. The stark reality they address is a troublingly high student-teacher ratio of 50:1 in public schools and exorbitant tuition fees in private institutions that can soar up to $7,500 per year per child.

What makes Kidato stand out? They maintain an impressive student-teacher ratio of 5:1, ensuring that each child receives personalized attention and support. Their educational model is built around delivering a rigorous international curriculum that parallels that of established private schools but comes at a fraction of the cost. This approach is designed to make quality education accessible, even in regions where affordability is a significant barrier.

Since launching their learning-from-home program, Kidato has seen encouraging momentum, enrolling over 30 students in their second semester alone. The future looks bright, as they anticipate tripling that number by their upcoming semester.

As part of the Y Combinator Batch W21, Kidato is positioned within an influential network of innovators. Their team of 15 dedicated employees is set on making significant strides in the ed-tech space, leveraging technology to bridge educational gaps.

With a focus on education and eLearning, Kidato is not just a startup; it’s a pivotal player in redefining how children in Africa can access quality education. For more information on their offerings, you can visit their website at [Kidato.co](https://www.kidato.co). 

In a landscape where high-quality education often feels out of reach for many families, Kidato is making strides to change that narrative—one student at a time.
